content.description: Excellent, low angle, hueco climbing a small, steep headwall.
content.location: Before old parking lot, look for a huecoed wall up a draw on the northside of canyon.  Two steep boulder problems at the entrance to the draw.

content.description: This has nice, easy, hueco climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts to coldshuts (now Mussy hook on right side). Please rap off to protect fixed gear. Don't lower off.
content.location:
It is on the North side of the canyon.  It is the 2nd climb, just right of

...Phlegmfoot

.  There is an obvious, huecoed tombstone.

content.description: A fun little route worth doing if you happened to bring a rack to a sport climbing area.  Climb obvious crack to shuts.  There are two shuts on the route at the crux which are unnecessary if you know how to place thin gear.
content.protection: Thin nuts (offsets nice) to med. cams.
content.location:
In back of the camp site just before crossing the dry stream bed for the first time.  This is an obvious

cul de sac

with an obvious and aesthetic little crack in the back.

Evil Barbecue

is just past this camp site.

content.description: A fun outing and worth doing if you are in the area.  Listed as 5.9 in the guide, this route is at least as hard as the 5.10c on the left of the tombstone feature in the first group of climbs.  You will enjoy this route more if you place a nut or cam enroute to the first bolt.  The route gets steep here with fun moves on steep pockets.
content.protection: Draws and a med nut or small cam down low.
content.location: Second route from the right in the second group of climbs after the pedestrian gate.  It follows the left of two arete/rib features to the right of the large buttress.

content.description:
Line of bolts up rib/arete feature.  Might bring a little thin gear for the start.  Listed as 5.9 in guide.  I'm the last to inflate grades, but that is just plain innaccurate.

Worth doing if you are in the area.
content.location: Right most climb in the second bevy of climbs.

content.description:
This is a fun, little thing to set up for folks who have never climbed before and located close to some nice 9s, 10s, and an 11, so a group can camp out here for a while with folks of all abilities.

Climb the low angled, huecoed face past an old homemade hanger (now 3 bolts) and up to chains.  Make sure you put gear in the horizontal before stepping right and going up to chain anchor.
content.protection:
Cams from small fingers to #2 Camalot.

Per

john strand

: this climb now has 3 bolts and decent belay bolts that need some chain work.
content.location: This is the first climb in the canyon.  After passing through pedestrian gate, go about 100 yards or so and you will see a group of 3 climbs.  There are two sport routes on an obvious tombstone, and this route is on the huecoed face to the right.

content.description: Squidbelly Phlegmfoot has pumpy hueco and layback climbing.
content.protection: 3 bolts (now Wave bolts) to cold shuts (now Mussy hooks). Please help to protect fixed gear by rappelling off instead of lowering off.
content.location: On the North side of the road, this is the 3rd route in the canyon. It is the furthest to the left on an obvious, huecoed tombstone.

content.description: Start on an undercling rail while smearing your feet, traverse to another rail, use an omg hold under the roof, then climb a very thin top out over the edge of the roof.
content.protection: 2-3 pads, might have to clean lichen out of the top out holds, so bring a steel brush.
content.location: This is just past ?? on the same side of the canyon.

content.description:
Do a boulder problem start to a shelf. I went up the middle off of a decent hold. It looks like others have gone up left of that. Clip the 1st bolt, move up, and get the 2nd. Then pull fun moves with huge holds over the roof. Clip the 3rd bolt (scary), and then make crux moves past the 4th bolt. This is a great climb with a lot of different types of moves.

Per

Jesse Morehouse

: a stickclip may be nice.

This is a combination of 2 submissions' information on the 1st submission's page...done to avoid confusion/duplication.
content.location:
It is on the right side of canyon, approximately 125 feet past

Evil Barbecue

.

Per

Jesse Morehouse

: walk up the old road from the pedestrian gate to where the road crosses the dry creekbed, and bear right instead of crossing. This is the only route on the tall formation.

content.description: Climb up crack feature on right of blank wall beside nice juniper shade tree and then go straight up the rounded arete above.  The climb is listed in the guide as an 11 and it is if the bolt line is followed.  The natural line trends right of the bolts and is 5.10.  Both ways are worth a go.  As with most Mullins' routes, the bolt placement is less than ideal.
content.location: Located in the second bevy of climbs up the canyon after the pedestrian gate.  Look for the large attractive juniper tree at the back of an old camp site just past the first set of climbs on the tombstone feature.

content.description:
This is on the right side of the canyon as the road/trail dips and crosses a dry streambed.

It is protected by 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. The 1st bolt is low. The 2nd bolt is at about 20 feet, but it is easier to get to than it looks. There are fun moves with the crux passing the 3rd bolt.
content.location:
Per

Jesse Morehouse

: this is a few hundred yards "downstream" from ?Lunging for Jesus?.

content.description: It looks a bit loose but is not.  This has decent, easy climbing with good pro.
content.location: Easy Witch is about 5 minutes in from the parking. It is kind of on its own on a small buttress.

content.description:
This is a fun variation to the 5."11"

Jesus Dashboard

. Start is the same but after the initial steep, crack feature work left on the ramp and up a gently overhanging, pocketed face.

NOTE: a few years ago the anchors had been vandalized but have since been replaced.
content.location: This is the leftmost climb in the second bevy of climbs encountered as you walk in from the pedestrian gate. The start is right next to a beautiful juniper shade tree against a featureless wall with a crack feature on its right end. This is the start.

content.description: This ascends the obvious crack of the formation. Climb directly up with fun stemming and pocketed moves protected on gear. When all the features disappear, jump into the crack, and finish on good jams. You can get a gear anchor to the left or use the tree to the right!
content.protection: Singles 0.5-#2 and an optional 4 for an anchor.
